content:
XhtmlPageAdapter Class

Definition

Provides a page adapter for the XHTML adapter set. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

In this Article

[System.Obsolete("The System.Web.Mobile.dll assembly has been deprecated and should no longer be used. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=157231.")]
public class XhtmlPageAdapter : System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.XhtmlAdapters.XhtmlControlAdapter, System.Web.UI.MobileControls.IPageAdapter
Inheritance
Object
ControlAdapter
XhtmlControlAdapter
XhtmlPageAdapter

Remarks

The XhtmlPageAdapter class inherits the XhtmlControlAdapter class and implements the IPageAdapter class.

Constructors

XhtmlPageAdapter()

Creates a new instance of the XhtmlPageAdapter class. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

public XhtmlPageAdapter ();

Properties

CacheVaryByHeaders

Gets a list of any additional HTTP headers by which caching is varied. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

public virtual System.Collections.IList CacheVaryByHeaders { get; }
Value
IList

An IList object of additional HTTP headers.

Remarks

The XhtmlPageAdapter class inherits the CacheVaryByHeaders property from the IPageAdapter interface and always returns null.

CookielessDataDictionary

Gets or sets the current cookieless stem.Web.UI.Page.Session* property data, if any. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

public System.Collections.IDictionary CookielessDataDictionary { get; set; }
Value
IDictionary

An IDictionary containing key/value pairs for the current cookieless stem.Web.HttpContext.Session* data, if any; otherwise, null.

Remarks

The CookielessDataDictionary property is populated when a valid IDictionary interface is configured as an attribute of the MobileControlsSection element.

EventArgumentKey

Gets the key for submitting the event argument. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

public virtual string EventArgumentKey { get; }
Value
String

A string representing the key.

Remarks

If an inheriting adapter overrides the EventArgumentKey property, it must also override the DeterminePostBackMode method to process the postback.

EventSourceKey

Gets the key for submitting the event source. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

public virtual string EventSourceKey { get; }
Value
String

A string representing the key.

Remarks

If an inheriting adapter overrides the EventSourceKey property, it must also override the DeterminePostBackMode method to process the postback.

OptimumPageWeight

Gets a page weight that is appropriate for the target device. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

public virtual int OptimumPageWeight { get; }
Value
Int32

An integer that represents the optimal number of bytes for a page on the target device.

Page

Gets or sets the page to which the adapter is attached. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

public override System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobilePage Page { get; set; }
Value
MobilePage

A MobilePage object.

PersistCookielessData

Gets or sets a Boolean value indicating whether items from the stem.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.XhtmlAdapters.XhtmlPageAdapter.CookielessDataDictionary* property are persisted in the query string. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

public bool PersistCookielessData { get; set; }
Value
Boolean

true if the CookielessDataDictionaryType in the MobileControls configuration section of the Web.config file is set to a valid dictionary type; otherwise, false.

Methods

CreateTextWriter(TextWriter)

Creates and returns a text writer that is appropriate for the target device. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

public virtual System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter CreateTextWriter (System.IO.TextWriter writer);
Parameters
writer
TextWriter

A TextWriter object or an object inherited from the TextWriter.

Returns
HtmlTextWriter

A new XhtmlTextWriter object based on the provided TextWriter object.

DeterminePostBackMode(HttpRequest, String, String, NameValueCollection)

Returns the postback data collection. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

public virtual System.Collections.Specialized.NameValueCollection DeterminePostBackMode (System.Web.HttpRequest request, string postEventSourceID, string postEventArgumentID, System.Collections.Specialized.NameValueCollection baseCollection);
Parameters
request
HttpRequest

The HttpRequest object that contains request information.

postEventSourceID
String

The source identifier for the event.

postEventArgumentID
String

An argument identifier for the event.

baseCollection
NameValueCollection

The collection of postback data from the request object.

Returns
NameValueCollection

A NameValueCollection object containing all query string or form parameters and values.

Remarks

Because some devices handle postback differently from others, the DeterminePostBackMode method allows the adapter to modify the collection.

DeviceQualifies(HttpContext)

Indicates whether the device adapter set applies to the specified request. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

public static bool DeviceQualifies (System.Web.HttpContext context);
Parameters
context
HttpContext

The HttpContext object for the current request.

Returns
Boolean

true if the stem.Web.Configuration.HttpCapabilitiesBase.PreferredRenderingType* for the browser is one of these members of the Doctype object: Doctype, Doctype, or Doctype; otherwise, false.

HandleError(Exception, HtmlTextWriter)

Called if an unhandled error occurs on the page. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

public virtual bool HandleError (Exception e, System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter writer);
Parameters
e
Exception

An Exception object.

writer
HtmlTextWriter

An HtmlTextWriter object.

Returns
Boolean

false.

Remarks

An adapter can choose to handle the error and display an error message. The XhtmlPageAdapter class does nothing and returns false.

HandlePagePostBackEvent(String, String)

Indicates whether the adapter handles the postback event. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

public virtual bool HandlePagePostBackEvent (string eventSource, string eventArgument);
Parameters
eventSource
String

The source identifier for the event.

eventArgument
String

The name of the event.

Returns
Boolean

false.

Remarks

The HandlePagePostBackEvent method is called during postback. An adapter can choose to handle the event. The XhtmlPageAdapter class does not handle the postback event and always returns false.

InitWriterState(XhtmlMobileTextWriter)

Configures the XhtmlMobileTextWriter object for the target device. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

protected virtual void InitWriterState (System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.XhtmlAdapters.XhtmlMobileTextWriter writer);
Parameters
writer
XhtmlMobileTextWriter

An XhtmlMobileTextWriter object.

Remarks

The InitWriterState method is called before rendering the page. This method sets the following properties on writer for the target device:

  • UseDivsForBreaks
  • SuppressNewLine
  • SupportsNoWrapStyle

OnPreRender(EventArgs)

Sets conditional pagination for the page. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

public override void OnPreRender (EventArgs e);
Parameters
e
EventArgs

The EventArgs object for the OnPreRender method.

Remarks

The OnPreRender method checks the ActiveForm property for the page. If the Action property is not empty, the Paginate property for the active form is set to false. The OnPreRender method calls the base OnPreRender method before exiting.

Note

The Form property inherits from the System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Panel class, which provides the Paginate property.

Render(XhtmlMobileTextWriter)

Sends the page content to a provided XhtmlMobileTextWriter, which renders the content to the client. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

public override void Render (System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.XhtmlAdapters.XhtmlMobileTextWriter writer);
Parameters
writer
XhtmlMobileTextWriter

An XhtmlMobileTextWriter object that writes the content to the client browser.

RenderUrlPostBackEvent(XhtmlMobileTextWriter, String, String)

Creates a link on the current page to enable postback on devices that do not support postback events. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

public virtual void RenderUrlPostBackEvent (System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.XhtmlAdapters.XhtmlMobileTextWriter writer, string target, string argument);
Parameters
writer
XhtmlMobileTextWriter

An XhtmlMobileTextWriter object that writes the link.

target
String

The target URL for postback.

argument
String

The name of the event for which the link is substituting.

Remarks

Some devices are able to execute a postback event on a link or button only. The RenderUrlPostBackEvent method writes a link with a URL that contains all of the information that is required to process the form and to update and display the page.
